page.title: 18TRANSPORT
page.content: USK AREA - CARS,BUSES,LORR,ROADS This is a farming and commuting area with most of the families having cars. There is a 'bus service through Gwehelog (from Newport to Monmouth) 8 times daily, 3 buses a day on the A472 from Pontypool to Usk, and 1 daily from Usk to Chepstow (a472 and B4235) No buses run on Sundays. A private bus service runs once a week (Tuesday) from Usk through Llancayo to the Market at Abergavenny. In the S.E. corner is the approach road A472 to the dual carriageway A449. This connects with the M50 and M5 to Birmingham, to the north, and the M4 to the south, to London and West Wales. There is much heavy traffic to, and from, the dual/c, using the narrow Usk main shopping street. This despite requests for a ban to be imposed on the vehicles.
